Posts.Content: On 1/31/2007 Judy1957 wrote: I was diagnosed about 3 weeks ago with DCIS.  It is in beginning stages of being invasive but doesn't seem to be in the lymph nodes yet.  My family has a history of breast cancer and my surgeon is in agreement that a bilateral will probably be a good choice as this is probably genetic.  I would appreciate input from those of you who have had the bilateral done, does it feel like it was the wrong decision and what are your thoughts on reconstruction.  My surgery is scheduled for the 13th of Feb. Hi Judy, Had my second Mastectomy 6 weeks ago, best desicion i ever made, as when i got my results back they found cancer in a different area to the original finding. As it is now the 26th February i gather you will already have had your op, hope you are feeling OK.  Had i not had a full Mastectomy this time it would have been quite some time before the second cancer was discovered, at which time i would have required Chemotherapy for a second time.  By having the Mastectomy i have been spared that this time. Jan
